question: The goal of an integrated marketing communications (IMC) program is to ________.

answers.text: have all of a company’s marketing and promotional activities project a consistent image and message to its target market

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That’s not correct. The marketing mix is product, price, place, and promotion; IMC is focused specifically on promotion.

answers.text: control all facets of a product’s distribution

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That’s not correct. While television advertising is one of the many tactics of the advertising promotional method, IMC focuses on many different methods in order to reach the consumer.

answers.text: communicate with customers only through television commercials

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That’s not correct. IMC does not control distribution.

answers.text: have complete control over all facets of the marketing mix

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: The goal of IMC is to communicate a clear and consistent message through various promotional mix methods that will reach the various segments of the target market.

detailedSolution: The goal of IMC is to communicate a clear and consistent message through various promotional mix methods that will reach the various segments of the target market.
